intro: Impatiens yaoshanensis, commonly known as the Yaoshan Impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically come in shades of pink and white. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in forest understories, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
